Comment:
Hi everyone!

I thought I would be on the receiving end of the Petrov this time against my Expert buddy Dave.  Things seemed to be going OK and then my kingside pawn structure got busted.  I then went into a K & P ending and Henry then got bogged down with disastrous results.  How does it happen?  Well, here we go .....

Hmm, in that Best Line my position does look drawish there with the ability to move Fou Lenoir freely.  My position is about to go further south.

36. ....... h5 - here I am in a zugzwang.  There is no way I can avoid losing my f4 pawn for starters.  Gameknot gives my score as  -9.55 which is more than a whole queen down so the resignation is justified.  The moral and the lesson here is, if your pawn structure is busted there is even less room for innaccuracies, especially when playing against somebody of near-master strength!
